sentences: She validates the device software against IEC 62304 standards every release cycle.
She does not validate the device software if the test environment is unstable.
Does she validate the device software whenever a new patch is deployed?
Doesn't she validate the device software before the clinical team uses it?
She is validating the device software right now while auditors observe remotely.
She is not validating the device software at the moment because the simulator is rebuilding.
Is she validating the device software on the latest prototype this afternoon?
Isn't she validating the device software although the risk level increased?
She has validated the device software for three different hardware configurations this quarter.
She has not validated the device software since the cybersecurity patch was applied.
Has she validated the device software for data-integrity issues?
Hasn't she validated the device software for UI alarms yet?
She has been validating the device software all morning without taking a break.
She has not been validating the device software because the requirement set was revised.
Has she been validating the device software from her home lab since dawn?
Hasn't she been validating the device software continuously during the submission sprint?
She validated the device software last night just before the FDA submission deadline.
She did not validate the device software yesterday because the test rig failed calibration.
Did she validate the device software after resolving the memory leak?
Didn't she validate the device software once the emergency patch was released?
She was validating the device software when the power outage hit the data center.
She was not validating the device software that evening; she was compiling the DHF instead.
Was she validating the device software at midnight as scheduled?
Wasn't she validating the device software when the auditor called?
She had validated the device software before the notified body requested evidence.
She had not validated the device software by the time the sprint review started.
Had she validated the device software on the new firmware revision?
Hadn't she validated the device software before the usability study began?
She had been validating the device software for hours when the critical defect surfaced.
She had not been validating the device software because the test database was corrupted.
Had she been validating the device software throughout the weekend release window?
Hadn't she been validating the device software until the build server crashed?
She will validate the device software tomorrow after the code freeze.
She will not validate the device software tonight if the unit tests still fail.
Will she validate the device software once the new requirements are approved?
Won't she validate the device software after integrating the AI module?
She will be validating the device software at this time next Monday.
She will not be validating the device software during the regulatory workshop.
Will she be validating the device software when the remote team logs in?
Won't she be validating the device software while the beta testers run scenarios?
She will have validated the device software for all safety classes by Friday.
She will not have validated the device software if the test stubs remain incomplete.
Will she have validated the device software before the certification gateway closes?
Won't she have validated the device software by the time the grant is reviewed?
She will have been validating the device software for twelve hours by the deployment cutoff.
She will not have been validating the device software all day if the cloud lab shuts down.
Will she have been validating the device software continuously until the MDR submission?
Won't she have been validating the device software for weeks when the pilot trial ends?
